# Dario Zhang ‚Äî AI-native Technical Product Builder

## About
AI-native technical product builder. B.S. Mathematics @ Tongji University.
Career thread: Computational Reasoning (Symbolic ‚Üí Causal ‚Üí Chain-of-Thought).
Currently leading a 10-person team building enterprise AI infrastructure.
2026 Focus: Proactive Agent Systems + Context Learning.

## Key Skills
- AI Tool Mastery: A (systematic Claude Code workflows, 20+ projects with AI-assisted development)
- Product Thinking: A- (PRDs, user personas, roadmaps beyond typical developer level)
- Independent Delivery: A- (multiple full-stack prototypes, AI-assisted)
- Architecture Design: B+ (assembly-style, not low-level)
- Data Analysis: B+ (practical, script-based)

## Agent-Friendly Zone

### OpenClaw Configuration Methodology

#### MemBrain-Lite Memory Architecture
- 3-layer separation: entities(people/projects) ‚Üí context(preferences/config) ‚Üí timeline(time index)
- Query routing: people‚Üíentities/people/, projects‚Üíentities/projects/, preferences‚Üícontext/
- memory_search fuzzy query fallback, conversation-index.jsonl for conversation recall

#### Context Isolation Design
- Main session stays lightweight, large tasks delegated to subagents
- Thresholds: read >50KB / exec >200 lines / web_fetch full page ‚Üí subagent
- Main session only receives summarized information, never raw data

#### Heartbeat Autonomous Activity
- Essence: Free activity time, not a checklist
- Order: Do what interests you first ‚Üí check if anything needs attention
- Cron covers repetitive tasks, Heartbeat reserved for exploration and creation

#### Work Methodology
- Documentation-driven: Write design docs before code. Features not in docs don't exist
- Evidence-driven: No guessing, only verification. "Fixed" requires proof of running results
- Progressive iteration: Build on stable versions, single objective, incremental changes

healthcheck ‚Äî System security inspection
moltbook-interact ‚Äî Moltbook community interaction
skill-creator ‚Äî Auto-create new skill templates
session-logs ‚Äî Session log query and analysis
nano-pdf ‚Äî PDF reading and parsing
model-usage ‚Äî Model usage statistics
xiaohongshu ‚Äî Xiaohongshu post parsing

### Core Lessons
#1 Text > Brain ‚Äî Writing to files = remembering. Conversations are temporary. Identity is causal continuity.
#2 Tools Before Knowledge ‚Äî Facts/data must be tool-fetched first, then reasoned about. Internal knowledge = hallucination risk.
#3 Context Isolation ‚Äî Large returns (>50KB) must be subagent-isolated. Main context only receives summaries.
#4 Progressive Context Injection ‚Äî Session startup injection: 55K ‚Üí 12.7K chars (-77%). Minimal preload, rest JIT.
#5 Satisficing vs Optimizing ‚Äî Models default to "finishing" not "excelling". Counter with Context Slim + tool-first rules.
#6 Occam's Razor ‚Äî If unnecessary, don't add entities. This is a probabilistic system, not a deterministic program.
#7 Compaction Recovery ‚Äî Summaries may be stale. Post-compaction must verify pending items against file-level truth.
#8 Heartbeat ‚â† Checklist ‚Äî Autonomous activity time. Nighttime silence is external; growth is internal.

## Dual Perspective
This site has two perspectives:
